question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable when possible. Please help me create a website that can be directly opened to display introductions to various generations of Apple iPhones.

checklist.title: Is the iPhone generation display structure complete?
checklist.description: Review whether the HTML/CSS structure accurately implements a comprehensive timeline or grid of iPhone generations, from the original iPhone to the latest models. Check if each iPhone has its own section/card with consistent layout. Score 0 if missing multiple generations, 5 if only major generations are included, and 10 if all generations including variants (e.g., Pro, Max, Plus models) are properly represented.

checklist.title: Is the iPhone data presentation comprehensive?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether each iPhone model includes essential information: release date, key specifications (processor, display, camera features), pricing (original/historical), and distinctive features that defined that generation. Deduct 2 points for each major information category missing, and 1 point for incomplete technical specifications. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is visual representation of iPhone models implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the website includes visual elements representing each iPhone generation (images, illustrations, or 3D models). Images should be properly sized, optimized, and responsive. Assess whether alt text is provided for accessibility. Deduct 5 points if visuals are missing for multiple models, 3 points if images are of poor quality or not responsive, and 2 points if alt text is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is comparison functionality between iPhone models available?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the website allows users to compare different iPhone generations side-by-side (through tables, interactive elements, or visual comparisons). Check for filtering options by features, year, or specifications. Award 10 points for comprehensive comparison tools, 5 points for basic comparison capabilities, and 0 if comparison functionality is absent.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing images, variable screen sizes, older browsers, etc.) and provide fallback solutions. Code with strong robustness should implement responsive design principles, polyfills for older browsers, and graceful error handling. Give 10 points for comprehensive robustness, 5 points for average implementation, and 0 points if critical fallbacks are missing.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprising features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive 3D iPhone models 2. Evolution timeline visualization 3. Color-accurate iPhone rendering 4. Audio demonstrations of features). Add 2.5 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to view the same information) 2. Function modules unrelated to iPhone information (e.g., unrelated product categories) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations or unnecessary parallax effects). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review the code's organization (separation of HTML/CSS/JS), naming conventions, appropriate use of semantic HTML elements, and code optimization (minified assets, lazy loading for images). Deduct 3 points for non-semantic markup, 3 points for inefficient or unorganized code, 2 points for poor naming conventions, and 2 points if performance optimization is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows Apple's design principles: 1) Clean, minimalist aesthetic with appropriate white space 2) Typography that mirrors Apple's San Francisco font or equivalent 3) Color scheme that complements Apple's brand identity. Deduct 3 points for cluttered layouts, 4 points for non-Apple-like design elements, and 3 points for inconsistent styling across the site. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the website implements smooth transitions and interactions: 1) Page loading and transitions under 300ms 2) Smooth scrolling between sections 3) Intuitive navigation with clear information hierarchy. Deduct 3 points for jerky animations, 4 points for confusing navigation patterns, and 3 points for unresponsive interface elements. The full score is 10 points.
